comment.text: The "FileMovedCount" translation key displays a count of files moved in the history panel. It is used when showing related items after a file has been moved to a trash or folder, providing context to the user about how many files have been affected.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation 'Ֆայլերը տեղափոխվել են ({{count}}):' literally translates to 'The files have been moved ({{count}}):'.  While not drastically wrong, it implies the action is completed, rather than reflecting a count of files moved. A more accurate translation would indicate a count rather than a completed action.  It's also a bit formal for a user interface.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Տեղափոխվել է ֆայլ {{count}}': (Telepoxvel e fayl {{count}}:) - '{{count}} files moved' or '{{count}} ֆայլ տեղափոխվեց:' ({{count}} fayl telepoxvec:) - '{{count}} file moved'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The colon at the end of the Armenian translation feels out of place for a typical user interface label. It's not common in such contexts.
The translation 'File spostati' should be 'Files spostati' to match the English plural 'Files'.
The Lao translation 'ເອກະພາກຖືກຍ້າຍ ({{count}}).' is a literal translation of 'File moved ({{count}})' which doesn't quite convey the plural 'Files moved'.  It translates to 'A file was moved'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ເອກະພາກຫລາຍຖືກຍ້າຍ ({{count}}).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation 'Fişiere au fost mutate ({{count}}).' is grammatically incorrect. It uses the plural 'Fişiere' (files) with the auxiliary verb 'au fost' (have been) which doesn't agree with the singular implied by the 'count' variable.  It should use the singular 'Fişier' and the singular 'a fost'.

The translation 'ගොනු ගෙනයන ලදි ({{count}}).' implies 'files are being moved' which isn't the precise meaning of 'Files moved ({{count}}).' A more accurate translation would convey a completed action.
The Sinhala word 'ඇවදින' is the better choice here, 'ගෙනයන' is not accurate in this context.

The translation 'Датотеке су премештене ({{count}}).' is grammatically correct but could be more natural. 'Files moved' can also be translated as 'Премештено је ({{count}})' or 'Премештено ({{count}})' to be more concise.

The translation 'Datoteke su premeštene ({{count}}).' is not the most natural or idiomatic translation of 'Files moved ({{count}}).' A more appropriate translation would be 'Premješteno je {count} datoteka.' or 'Premešteno {count} datoteka.' The current translation sounds a bit awkward.

The Ukrainian translation "Файли переміщено ({{count}})." uses the neuter plural past tense verb 'переміщено' which is grammatically incorrect. It should be in the plural imperfective tense to agree with 'файли'.
